title: Bahl '24: Make tech adaptable to foster inclusivity - The Brown Daily Herald
content: Bahl '24: Make tech adaptable to foster inclusivity  The Brown Daily Herald
description: When I try to check in for international flights online, I’m not always able to. The country of birth listed on my passport — Hong Kong — is only sometimes listed as an option when selecting a country, depending on the airline. When it isn’t, I have to head to the airport early, explain to the staff the unique characteristics of my passport and pray that they’re willing to help me out. Usually, this is more of an inconvenience to me than anything else, but it raises the question: Who gets to decide what a country is? And if someone is arbitrarily making that decision, what lines are being drawn in the context of other, even more fluid realms of data, like gender, sexuality or race?
